03_central_limit_theorem/02_normal/01_compare_zs_v1

A farm produces 4 types of fruit: oranges, pineapples, kiwis, and persimmons. The fruitsâ€™ masses follow normal distributions, with population parameters dependent on the type of fruit.

_ Type of fruit _ _ Mean mass (g) _ _ Standard deviation of mass (g) _
oranges 194 12
pineapples 1474 130
kiwis 66 4
persimmons 137 11

One specimen of each type is weighed. The results are shown below.

_ Specimen type _ _ Mass of specimen (g) _
orange 200.6
pineapple 1722
kiwi 64.84
persimmon 145

The population parameters and specimen masses can be downloaded as a csv.

For each measurement, determine the standard score and the cumulative probability. Then determine which specimen is most unusually large, most unusually small, most typically sized, and most unusually sized.


  1. Calculate a \(z\) score for the orange specimen. (Round to the nearest hundredth.)
  2. What proportion of oranges have less mass than the orange specimen?
  3. Calculate a \(z\) score for the pineapple specimen. (Round to the nearest hundredth.)
  4. What proportion of pineapples have less mass than the pineapple specimen?
  5. Calculate a \(z\) score for the kiwi specimen. (Round to the nearest hundredth.)
  6. What proportion of kiwis have less mass than the kiwi specimen?
  7. Calculate a \(z\) score for the persimmon specimen. (Round to the nearest hundredth.)
  8. What proportion of persimmons have less mass than the persimmon specimen?
  9. The orange specimen is most unusually large. / The pineapple specimen is most unusually large. / The kiwi specimen is most unusually large. / The persimmon specimen is most unusually large.
  10. The orange specimen is most unusually small. / The pineapple specimen is most unusually small. / The kiwi specimen is most unusually small. / The persimmon specimen is most unusually small.
  11. The orange specimen is most typically sized. / The pineapple specimen is most typically sized. / The kiwi specimen is most typically sized. / The persimmon specimen is most typically sized.
  12. The orange specimen is most unusually sized. / The pineapple specimen is most unusually sized. / The kiwi specimen is most unusually sized. / The persimmon specimen is most unusually sized.
